info.description:
Looking for product information? Visit arubanetworks.com
Working on a project and need a copy of the OpenAPI schema? View/download it here
Having trouble with the API explorer? Go to the Aruba Support Portal

API Authentication

This session is using the API token from the Aruba Fabric Composer UI. Proceed with any API call!
To begin using this API explorer, you'll first need to obtain an API key:
  • Navigate to POST /auth/token (this link opens a new window)
  • Click Try it out
  • To specify credentials, set the values of the following header parameters:
    • X-Auth-Username: your Aruba Fabric Composer account user name
    • X-Auth-Password: your Aruba Fabric Composer account password
    • NOTE: Users which are mapped to authentication sources of type pki do not need to include these headers. If they are included with a request which uses a verifiable client certificate which successfully authenticates the API user, these headers will simply be ignored.
      If a client certificate is supplied which is either not verifiable or does not map to a valid API user, then the above headers will be used (if they are supplied) as a fallback mechanism.
  • Click Execute
  • In the response body section, copy the value of "result" (without quotes) to the clipboard.
    This is your API key. By default, it is valid for 30 minutes.
  • Click the "Authorize" button below (to the right of the "schemes" dropdown)
  • Paste the API key into the text box (without quotes or other formatting)
  • Click "authorize" to save the API key in the Swagger UI. Note that this does not validate the token for copy/paste or other typographical errors
  • You may now use the API Explorer to make live API calls to Aruba Fabric Composer

API Versions

There are two ways to specify the Aruba Fabric Composer API version in your requests:

  • HTTP request header. For example, to request API version 1:

    Accept: application/json; version=1

  • URL path. For example, to request API version 1:

    https://fabricmanager.example.com/api/v1

Automatic token refresh

  • Pass the X-Auth-Refresh-Token header with a value of true to automatically refresh (reset the expiration time) of the token used in the request
  • See POST /auth/token for more details

Generic Responses

Unless specifically noted in the documentation for a given API call, the following responses can be returned:

  • 401 Unauthorized response occurs when any of these conditions are present:

    • User did not supply a token in the Authorization header OR
    • User supplied an unknown token OR
    • User supplied expired token
    • PKI User supplied a valid token created by a user which does not map to the client certificate supplied in the request
    • PKI User supplied a valid token without supplying a client certificate

  • 404 Not Found response occurs when both:

    • The API version is not specified in the request header and
    • The API version is not found in the URL

  • 415 Unsupported Media Type response occurs when any of these conditions are present:

    • The Content-Type header is missing from the request OR
    • The Content-Type header has a value other than application/json

HTTP 202 "Cache build in progress" Responses

The Aruba Fabric Composer platform operates in an "eventual consistency" model with respect to the data that it ingests from external systems it integrates with.

The following conditions precipitate the HTTP 202 response for select endpoints:

  • Aruba Fabric Composer has been initially deployed in a new environment
  • Aruba Fabric Composer has recently been upgraded
  • An Aruba Fabric Composer sensor has been explicitly restarted as a result of a reboot or other maintenance activity

This response indicates that Aruba Fabric Composer is in the process if achieving consistency with one or more external systems.

In order to present the most accurate data possible, this response is used to alert clients to retry their request again. Due to the varying nature of the amount of time it takes to achieve such consistency (primarily the external system data set size), clients should retry (with a reasonable interval) until an HTTP 200 response is received.

The endpoints which are subject to this condition are explicitly documented with the HTTP 202 response code in their respective schemas. See GET /api/v1/hosts for an example.

If a seemingly unreasonable amount of time passes before an HTTP 200 response is received, or a given request always returns HTTP 202, please contact Support.

delete.summary: Delete an API access token
delete.description:
This call uses the same __`Authorization`__ header as other authenticated calls to process the token.
* Returns __`200 OK`__ status if the token is valid and was deleted.
* Returns __`401 Unauthorized`__ status if the token is not found or is expired.
If expired, the token is still deleted (as it is with any other authenticated call)

post.summary: Get an API access token
post.description:
Generates a unique token with every successful call
* Tokens are kept in a distributed key-value store
* Users which are mapped to authentication sources of type __`pki`__ are required to include their client certificate with __every__ request where the authentication token obtained here is used
* Obtaining authorization tokens using a client certificate is not currently supported in the API Explorer UI
* A given user can have a maximum of 10 tokens in use at the same time.
  * Additional token requests beyond that limit will cause older tokens (expired or not) to be deleted to allow new token provisioning
  * See also [DELETE /auth/token](#/auth/deleteApiKey) - users can explicitly delete their authentication tokens (instead of waiting for token expiration or rotation)
* Token will be usable for the number of minutes stored in the __`token_lifetime`__ property of the calling user's database record
* To determine what the value of __`token_lifetime`__ is for the calling user, see the value returned within `GET /api/users/current`
* The _default_ __`token_lifetime`__ property value is __`30`__ (minutes). 
* Set the __`X-Auth-Refresh-Token`__ header to __`true`__ with any authenticated API call in order to automatically extend the token expiration for the calling user.
Requires the token used in the authenticated request to be valid and not yet expired

404.description: Request did not specify API version

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
DNS Client Configuration
 * description - describes this DNS Client Configuration object
 * domain_name - specifies the domain name - RFC 1035
 * name - names this DNS Client Configuration object
 * name_servers - list of name servers in IPv4 or IPv6 format
 * domain_list - search list of default local domain names

To create a DNS Client Configuration's associations with:
 * management_software - whether or not Management Software uses this DNS Client Configuration
  * fabric_uuids: UUIDs of any fabrics with which this configuration is associated
 * switch_uuids -UUIDs of any switches with which this configuration is associated

Note: __`domain_name`__ and __`domain_list`__ are mutually exclusive.

400.description: Must specify domain_name or domain_list, but not both

patch.summary: Patch request to update host objects
patch.description:
Update one or more hosts using JSON patch(es) with their UUIDs.
The following patch __`operation`__ is supported:
* `replace`

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported for access ports:
* `/associated_objects/ilo/uid_indicator`
* `/associated_objects/ilo/power_state`

Notes:
Patches are applied as follows:
* Either the __`update_all`__ query parameter or __`uuids`__ property in the request body object must be provided
* If a list of __`uuids`__ are provided in the request body:
  * The UUIDs must be associated with the hosts
  * The matching __`patch`__ in the body will be applied to all hosts whose UUID is in the __`uuids`__ list
  * Note that the use of the __`update_all`__ query parameter and inclusion of the __`uuids`__ property in the request object are mutually exclusive features.

parameters.name: Host patch request
parameters.description: Apply an array of patches to host resources

parameters.description: Update all hosts with the first patch request

parameters.name: port_type
parameters.description:
Filter the result set based on the value of each object's `type` property value, which can be one of:
* `access`: exist by default on switches and are for general use.
* `fabric`: are special ports, used solely for fabric switch-to-switch connections

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Include related tag list as a property of each object in the response body

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Filter the result set based on the value of each object's `type` property value.
* Link Aggregation Groups with type `provisioned` have been explicitly configured on switches and can contain one or more ports.
* Link Aggregation Groups with type `internal` exist by default on switches and contain only one port. Think of these as objects that simply hold configuration state (e.g. configured line speed).

parameters.name: vlan_groups
parameters.description: Include an array of associated VLAN Group objects with each Link Aggregation Group object in the response body.

patch.summary: Patch request to update LAG objects
patch.description:
Update one or more Link Aggregation Groups using JSON patch(es) with their UUIDs.

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported for the __`replace`__ operation:
* `/description`
* `/mac_learning_attachments`
* `/mac_learning_attachments/{index}/mac_address`
* `/mac_learning_attachments/{index}/vlan`
* `/mac_learning_configuration`
* `/mac_learning_configuration/aging`
* `/mac_learning_configuration/learning_limit`
* `/mac_learning_configuration/mode`
* `/mac_learning_configuration/violation_action`
* `/mac_learning_use_default_configuration`
* `/name`
* `/native_vlan`
* `/qos_ingress_policies`
* `/tags`
* `/ungrouped_vlans`
* `/vlan_group_uuids`
* `/enable_lossless`

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported for the __`add`__ operation:
* `/qos_ingress_policies`
* `/vlan_group_uuids`

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported for the __`remove`__ operation:
* `/qos_ingress_policies`
* `/vlan_group_uuids`

Notes:
Patches are applied as follows:
* Either the __`update_all`__ query parameter or __`uuids`__ property in the request body object must be provided
* If a list of __`uuids`__ are provided in the request body:
  * The UUIDs must be associated with the LAGs
  * The matching __`patch`__ in the body will be applied to all LAGs whose UUID is in the __`uuids`__ list
  * Note that the use of the __`update_all`__ query parameter and inclusion of the __`uuids`__ property in the request object are mutually exclusive features.

parameters.name: oui
parameters.description:
Return a list of MAC attachments matching an MAC address  OUI prefix.
The parameter value constructed by clients must be a string representation: a url-encoded MAC address OUI prefix.
* The first 3 bytes are used to filter the request.

For example: `AB:CD:EF:XX:XX:XX`  Will return all MAC addresses with a OUI prefix of `AB:CD:EF`

patch.summary: Patch Request to update Port objects
patch.description:
Update one or more ports using JSON patch(es) with their UUIDs.

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported for access ports for the __`replace`__ operations:
* `/admin_state`
* `/description`
* `/downlink_switch_uuid`
* `/ecn`
* `/name`
* `/native_vlan`
* `/speed/configure`
* `/tags`
* `/type`
* `/ungrouped_vlans`
* `/qsfp_mode`
* `/vlan_group_uuids`
* `/bridge_loop_detection/mode`
* `/bridge_loop_detection/interval`
* `/ecn`
* `/enable_lossless`
* `/pause`
* `/routed`
* `/qos_ingress_policies`
* `/qsfp_transform`

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported for fabric ports for the __`replace`__ operations:
* `/ecn`
* `/type`
* `/qsfp_mode`
* `/pause`
* `/ecn`
* `/mtu`
* `/enable_lossless`
* `/qsfp_transform`

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported for access ports for the __`add`__ and __`remove`__ operations:
* `/qos_ingress_policies`

Notes:
Patches are applied as follows:
* Either the __`update_all`__ query parameter or __`uuids`__ property in the request body object must be provided
* If a list of __`uuids`__ are provided in the request body:
  * The UUIDs must be associated with the ports
  * The matching __`patch`__ in the body will be applied to all ports whose UUID is in the __`uuids`__ list
  * Note that the use of the __`update_all`__ query parameter and inclusion of the __`uuids`__ property in the request object are mutually exclusive features.

patch.summary: Patch Request to update a Switch object
patch.description:
Update a switch object using JSON patch(es) with its UUID.
The following patch __`ops`__ are supported:
* `replace`

The following patch __`paths`__ are supported:
* `/description`
* `/ip_address`
* `/ip_address_v6`
* `/ip_gateway`
* `/ip_gateway_v6`
* `/ip_mask`
* `/ip_mask_v6`
* `/ip_mode` - `static` or `dhcp`
* `/ip_mode_v6` - `static` or `dhcp`
* `/name`
* `/tags`
* `/fabric_uuid`
* `/role`
* `/hostname`

Notes:
* Patches for switches are applied to only one switch at a time.
* The use of update_all is not supported.

* To disable IPv4 specify `0.0.0.0` for a `static` `ip_address_v4`
* Currently IPv6 must be disabled by using `::` for a `static` `ip_address_v6`

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Syslog Client Configuration
To create a Syslog Client Configuration attributes with:
 * description - describes this Syslog object.
 * name - names this Syslog object.
     Defaults to 514.
 * facility - facility of messages to log.
 * logging_persistent_storage - a list, which contains:
 * severity - Preserves logs of the specified severity    and higher in persistent storage.
 * enable - Enable logging to persistent    storage on an ongoing basis.
 * entity_list - list of entities.
   Each contains:
 * host - address of remote syslog server.    Specify a hostname, IPv4 or IPv6 address.
 * port - optional internet port for host.
 * severity - severity of messages to log.
 * include_auditable_events - Specifies whether auditable   events should be transmitted to the remote syslog    server..
 * tls_auth_mode - TLS authentication mode used to    authenticate the server
 * transport - Transport layer protocol used to    forward messages to the server.
 * unsecure_tls_renegotiation - Enable TLS session with    syslog server which does not support secure    renegotiation.

To create a Syslog Client Configuration's associations with:
 * fabric_uuids: UUIDs of any fabrics with which this configuration is associated.
 * switch_uuids: UUIDs of any switches with which this configuration is associated.

cache_sync_status.description: Cache Sync Status provides information related to the state of the pack's object cache.  It provides if a cache build is in progress, the reason why it is building, and the start and end times of the cache build process.  At the start of a cache build, cache_sync_start is set to the current time, while cache_sync_complete is set to zero.  At the completion of the cache build, cache_sync_complete is updated with the current time.

cache_sync_start.description: UTC epoch time of cache sync start

cache_sync_complete.description: UTC epoch time of cache sync complete

cache_sync_reason.description: Indicates the reason why a cache sync occurred

cache_sync.description: Indicates if a cache sync is in progress

stream_id.description: Event stream this audit object belongs to

event_object.description: Current state of the object affected by this event.

log_date.description: Epoch time in milliseconds when audit object was created.

config.description:
Authentication source configuration object will vary by the value of `type`. See model definitions for the following: 
* Object: Aruba Fabric Composer Authentication Source (LDAP)

This defines an LDAP client configuration for:
* Management software LDAP -  defines management software LDAP Users on CFM and its relationship to a single local or remote LDAP Server.
* Switches LDAP - defines relationship between fabrics and/or switches, and remote LDAP server(s).
Both management software and switches may share the same configuration.

dn_template.description:
LDAP user Distinguished Name template.
Only applicable to management software.
* The substring {{username}} will be replaced with the username when an LDAP user attempts to authenticate and retrieve an authorization token.

Example values based on server type:
* Active directory: `{{username}}`
* OpenLDAP: `uid={{username}}, ou=Admins, dc=example` dc=com`

management_software.description: If True enables management software LDAP

ssl.description:
Startup mode for SSL / TLS.
Applicable to both management software and switches.
* For management software, if `on` or `start_tls`
this will enable SSL secure mode.
* For switches, if `on` or `start_tls` this will enable SSL or TLS, respectively.

tls_cacertfile.description:
X.509 certificate file path.
Only applicable to switches.

tls_cert.description:
TLS certification file path.
Only applicable to switches.

tls_key.description:
TLS private key file path.
Only applicable to switches.

tls_reqcert.description:
Mode for SSL / TLS.
Only applicable to switches.
If  any accepted value except `never` and ssl is `on` or `start_tls` will verify tls files specified in tls_cacertfile, tls_cert and tls_key file paths.

items.description:
Full URI spec for Host name or IP of LDAP server.  Adding a port suffix e.g. ':636' is optional.
  For switch or management software configurations.
For management software, with a local ldap server, use ['//localhost']

verify_ssl.description:
When true along with `ssl == on or start_tls `, validates the LDAP Server certificate signing chain against the list of trusted CA certificates in /etc/pki/ca-trust/extracted/pem/tls-ca-bundle.pem. See details in https://www.unix.com/man-page/centos/8/update-ca-trust/ for more information regarding trusted CA certificate management.
Only applicable to management software.

name.example: Enterprise Directory Service for Management Software

switches.description:
List of switch UUIDs
In 'partial_mesh' mode, all other switches will establish an IBGP session with the switches specified here
In 'route_reflector' mode, this list should select exactly two switches to act as route reflectors
In 'full_mesh' mode, or when intra-fabric BGP is disabled, the contents of this list are ignored

enable_lossless.description: When true, priority flow control will be enabled and configured on all ports that are part of this LAG with settings defined for queue_configuration in the fabric settings.

mac_learning_attachments.description: MAC attachments learned or configured on this Link Aggregation Group

mlag.description: True if this Link Aggregation Group is an MLAG; false otherwise.

native_vlan.description:
This VLAN is:
* Applied to all untagged traffic coming in to this Link Aggregation Group (ingress)
* Removed from all traffic tagged with this VLAN which is leaving this Link Aggregation Group (egress)
* NOTE: a native_vlan value of 0 means that any untagged traffic will be dropped on either ingress or egress

qos_ingress_policies.description:
QoS ingress policies for this LAG.  This is an ordered list.  On a PUT:
* If the field is not set, leave the existing list alone.
* If the field is set to an empty list, remove all QoS policies associated with this LAG.
* If the field is set to a non-empty list, replace the existing QoS policy list with the given list.

port_properties.description:
Switch port properties associated with this Link Aggregation Group.
* Each object is scoped specifically to the switch to which the contained LAG member port UUIDs are related.
* For example, an MLAG with two ports on two different switches will have two port_properties objects, each with two port UUIDs and switch-specific configuration settings.

type.description:
* `provisioned` Link Aggregation Groups have been explicitly configured on switches and can contain one or more ports.
* `internal` Link Aggregation Groups exist by default on switches and contain only one port. Think of `internal` Link Aggregation Groups as logical objects that simply hold configuration state (e.g. LACP mode and configured line speed).

ungrouped_vlans.description: VLANs directly assigned to this Link Aggregation Group, not in a VLAN group, presented as a sorted set of ranges.

vlan_groups.description: VLAN groups associated with this Link Aggregation Group.

vlans.description: The effective VLANs assigned to this Link Aggregation Group, including VLAN groups and directly assigned VLANs, presented as a sorted set of ranges.

station_mac_address.description: MAC address of switch on which neighbor was received.

chassis_id.description: Chassis ID of neighbor.  What's in this field is specified by the `Chassis Subtype`.

chassis_subtype.description:
Subtype of the Chassis ID.  It can be one of the following:
* Chassis Component (1): possibly EntPhysicalAlias (RFC 4133)
* Interface Alias (2): ifAlias (RFC 2863)
* Port Component (3): possibly EntPhysicalAlias (RFC 4133)
* MAC Address (4): MAC address
* Network Address (5): networkAddress
* Interface Name (6): ifName (RFC 2863)
* Locally Assigned (7): local, alpha numeric string

port_id.description: Port ID of the received neighbor.

port_subtype.description:
Subtype of the Port ID. It can be one of the following:
* Interface Alias (1): ifAlias (RFC 2863)
* Port Component (2): possibly entPhysicalAlias (RFC 4133)
* MAC Address (3): MAC address
* Network Address (4): networkAddress
* Interface Name (5): ifName (RFC 2863)
* Agent Circuit ID (6): agent circuit ID (RFC 3046)
* Locally Assigned (7): local, alpha numeric string

ttl.description: Time To Live.  Amount of time, in seconds, the neighbor is valid.

source_mac_address.description: MAC Address of _sender_ of LLDP/CDP neighbor.

system_name.description:
System Name of received neighbor.
An alpha-numeric string indicating administratively assigned name (should be fully qualified name or sysName as specified by RFC 3418).

system_description.description:
System Description of received neighbor. An alpha-numeric string specifying system's hardware, operating system, and networking software.
If RFC 3418 is supported, sysDescr should be used.

mgmt_address.description: Management Address of received neighbor. What's contained in this field is defined by the `mgmt_address_subtype` field.

mgmt_address_subtype.description:
Management Address Subtype of received neighbor.
See: https://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/ protocol-numbers.xhtml

mgmt_address_ifnum.description: Interface number of management address of received neighbor. What's contained in this field is defined by the `mgmt_address_ifnum_subtype` field.

mgmt_address_ifnum_subtype.description:
Subtype of the Interface Number in the received neighbor. It can be one of 3 values:
* Unknown (1)
* ifIndex (2)
* System port number (3)

port_description.description: IEEE 802 LAN station's port description of received neighbor. This is an alpha-numeric string that should be `ifDescr` if RFC 2863 is implemented.

port_vlanid.description: The VLAN ID of the port.  A value of zero shall be used if the system doesn't know the PVID or not support port-based VLAN operation

lag_id.description:
LAG ID of remote end.  This is carried in the LAG TLV.
As specified in Annex E.8 of IEEE 802.1AB

enabled_capabilities.description:
A bit map specifying the currently enabled capabilities:
>Bit  1: Other
>Bit  2: Repeater (RFC 2108)
>Bit  3: MAC Bridge (IEEE 802.1D)
>Bit  4: WLAN Access Point (IEEE 802.11 MIB)
>Bit  5: Router (RFC 1812)
>Bit  6: Telephone (RFC 4293)
>Bit  7: DOCSIS Cable Device (RFC 4693, RFC 4546)
>Bit  8: Station Only (RFC 4293)
>Bit  9: C-VLAN Component of VLAN Bridge (IEEE 802.1Q)
>Bit 10: S-VLAN Component of VLAN Bridge (IEEE 802.1Q)
>Bit 11: Two-port MAC Relay (IEEE 802.1Q)

supported_capabilities.description:
A bit map specifying the capabilities supported by the sender
>Bit  1: Other
>Bit  2: Repeater (RFC 2108)
>Bit  3: MAC Bridge (IEEE 802.1D)
>Bit  4: WLAN Access Point (IEEE 802.11 MIB)
>Bit  5: Router (RFC 1812)
>Bit  6: Telephone (RFC 4293)
>Bit  7: DOCSIS Cable Device (RFC 4693, RFC 4546)

>Bit  9: C-VLAN Component of VLAN Bridge (IEEE 802.1Q)
>Bit 10: S-VLAN Component of VLAN Bridge (IEEE 802.1Q)
>Bit 11: Two-port MAC Relay (IEEE 802.1Q)

System Description of received neighbor. An alpha-numeric string specifying system's hardware, operating system, and networking software.
If RFC 3418 is supported, sysDescr should be used.

mgmt_address.description: Management Address of received neighbor. What's contained in this field is defined by the `mgmt_address_subtype` field.

mgmt_address_subtype.description:
Management Address Subtype of received neighbor.
See: https://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/ protocol-numbers.xhtml

mgmt_address_ifnum.description: Interface number of management address of received neighbor. What's contained in this field is defined by the `mgmt_address_ifnum_subtype` field.

mgmt_address_ifnum_subtype.description:
Subtype of the Interface Number in the received neighbor. It can be one of 3 values:
* Unknown (1)
* ifIndex (2)
* System port number (3)

port_description.description: IEEE 802 LAN station's port description of received neighbor. This is an alpha-numeric string that should be `ifDescr` if RFC 2863 is implemented.

port_vlanid.description: The VLAN ID of the port.  A value of zero shall be used if the system doesn't know the PVID or not support port-based VLAN operation

lag_id.description:
LAG ID of remote end.  This is carried in the LAG TLV.
As specified in Annex E.8 of IEEE 802.1AB

enabled_capabilities.description:
A bit map specifying the currently enabled capabilities:
>Bit  1: Other
>Bit  2: Repeater (RFC 2108)
>Bit  3: MAC Bridge (IEEE 802.1D)
>Bit  4: WLAN Access Point (IEEE 802.11 MIB)
>Bit  5: Router (RFC 1812)
>Bit  6: Telephone (RFC 4293)
>Bit  7: DOCSIS Cable Device (RFC 4693, RFC 4546)
>Bit  8: Station Only (RFC 4293)
>Bit  9: C-VLAN Component of VLAN Bridge (IEEE 802.1Q)
>Bit 10: S-VLAN Component of VLAN Bridge (IEEE 802.1Q)
>Bit 11: Two-port MAC Relay (IEEE 802.1Q)

supported_capabilities.description:

>Bit 11: Two-port MAC Relay (IEEE 802.1Q)

cache_sync_status.description: Cache Sync Status provides information related to the state of the pack's object cache.  It provides if a cache build is in progress, the reason why it is building, and the start and end times of the cache build process.  At the start of a cache build, cache_sync_start is set to the current time, while cache_sync_complete is set to zero.  At the completion of the cache build, cache_sync_complete is updated with the current time.

split_admin_status.description:
Admin state of the split capable port 
Before split - Parent: active, Child: inactive 
After split, but before reboot - Parent: inactive, Child: active 
After split and reboot - Parent: inactive, Child: active 
After unsplit before reboot - Parent: active, Child: inactive

split_oper_status.description:
operational state of the split capable port 
Before split - Parent: active, Child: inactive 
After split, but before reboot - Parent: inactive, Child: inactive 
After split and reboot - Parent: inactive, Child: active 
After unsplit before reboot - Parent: inactive, Child: inactive

bridge_loop_detection.description: Bridge loop detection setting for this port.

interval.description: Bridge loop detection interval in milliseconds.

mode.description: The operational mode for bridge loop detection on this port.

default_state.description:
Indicates that a port:
* When in default state is configurable for changing the type property
* When not in the default state it is NOT configurable for changing the type property

downlink_switch_uuid.description: UUID of the downlink switch connected to this port.

ecn.description: Set ECN on packets that experience congestion on these COS levels when leaving this port.  An empty list will disable ECN on this port.

enable_lossless.description: When true, priority flow control will be enabled and configured with settings defined for queue_configuration in the fabric settings.

is_uplink.description: Denotes whether this port is an "uplink" port

l2vpn_information.description: If the `l2vpn` query parameter is `true`, this list will contain any associated L2VPN UUIDs and their names.

link_state.description: The link state of this port.

name.example: Port for Host X NIC Y

native_vlan.description:
This VLAN is:
* Applied to all untagged traffic coming in to this Port (ingress)
* Removed from all traffic tagged with this VLAN which is leaving this Port (egress)
* NOTE: a native_vlan value of 0 means that any untagged traffic will be dropped on either ingress or egress

qos_ingress_policies.description:
QoS ingress policies for this port.  This is an ordered list.  On a PUT:
* If the field is not set, leave the existing list alone.
* If the field is set to an empty list, remove all QoS policies associated with this port.
* If the field is set to a non-empty list, replace the existing QoS policy list with the given list.

port_label.description: Port Label (for display purposes). Syntax varies based on hardware configuration (usually QSFP mode).

port_security_enabled.description:
Indicates that port security is:
* `true` - enabled
* `false` - disabled

qsfp_transform.description: QSFP transform status of this port.split - ports are in split modeno-split - ports are in unsplit modenot applicable

reason.description: Current status of the split operation

lane_state.description: lane_state of this port.lane_split - ports are in split modelanes_not_split - ports are in unsplit mode

read_only.description:
Indicates that this port is:

staging_state.title: Object: Switch Software Staging State Details

groups.description: The state of a switch software staging process.

state.description:
The staging state of this group.  This is an aggregate of the staging state of each switch in the group.  States have the following meaning:
  * __`completed`__ - All switch states are __`completed`__.
  * __`failed`__ - At least one switch in the group is __`failed`__.
  * __`in progress`__ - At least one switch in the group is __`in progress`__ and none are __`failed`__, or the switch states are some combination of __`pending`__ and __`completed`__.
  * __`pending`__ - All switch states are __`pending`__.

transport.description: Transport layer protocol used to forward messages to the server.

If the fabric is expanded the new switch will automatically pick up the new settings covered by `fabric_uuid`. To exclude, specify value as the empty array: __`[]`__

management_software.description: Whether or not Management Software uses this Syslog configuration. To exclude, specify value as __`False`__.

upgrade_type.description: Type of upgrade.  Sequenced or immediate upgrade.When sequenced upgrade is selected, returned groups will have sequenced order assigned, rather than the order originally specified by the user.

groups.description: Switch software upgrade groups.  Groups themselves are staged serially, but switches within each group may be staged serially or in parallel.

switches.description: Switches and optional partition to be upgraded.If boot partition not specified, it defaults to the non-active (not currently booted) partition.

uuid.description: UUID of Switch to be rebooted.

boot_partition.description: Indicates which boot partition to upgrade firmware from.Not specifying will result in usingthe non-active partition.

upgrade_state.title: Object: Switch Software Upgrade State Details

groups.description: The state of a switch software upgrade process.

state.description:
The upgrade state of this group.  This is an aggregate of the staging state of each switch in the group.  States have the following meaning:
  * __`completed`__ - All switch states are __`completed`__.
  * __`failed`__ - At least one switch in the group is __`failed`__.
  * __`in progress`__ - At least one switch in the group is __`in progress`__ and none are __`failed`__, or the switch states are some combination of __`pending`__ and __`completed`__.
  * __`pending`__ - All switch states are __`pending`__.

switches.description: The state of software upgrade for a switch.

boot_partition.description: Indicates which boot partition to stage firmware.Not specifying this parameter means to stage to the non-active boot partition.

state.description: The upgrade state of this switch.
The upgrade state of this group.

cache_sync_status.description: Cache Sync Status provides information related to the state of the pack's object cache.  It provides if a cache build is in progress, the reason why it is building, and the start and end times of the cache build process.  At the start of a cache build, cache_sync_start is set to the current time, while cache_sync_complete is set to zero.  At the completion of the cache build, cache_sync_complete is updated with the current time.
